Let me rephrase my assesment of what probably happened. The CVS Decorator 
caused an exception to occur and the decorator thread tried to display the 
exception using a dialog. The dialog was opened in a non-ui thread which caused 
the SWT Exception. This is problematic for 2 reasons. One, the user never gets 
to see the actual error and, two, the decorator thread should probably not be 
throwing up a dialog since the error may have nothing to do with what the user 
is doing at the time. Perhaps a logging of the exception is more appropriate. 

P.S. This is probably more severe then minor given that, if an exception does 
occur in a decorator, the user (and hence the bug report) will have no 
indication of what really went wrong.
